body:
I can't seem to find proper documentation about it but I think I remember by default Go was compiling for ARMv6 if not specified otherwise. And it looks like you have an ARMv5 architecture.

What is surprising is that it was working in 1.52 though.

Would you be able to try to compile it for ARMv5? (works from a Linux/Windows/Mac machine with Go installed)

```
$ git clone https://github.com/rclone/rclone.git
$ cd rclone
$ CGO_ENABLED=0 GOARM=5 GOARCH=arm GOOS=linux go build
```

I just check the build script

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/7e2488af10b316115217dc8246024d3de692d283/bin/cross-compile.go#L77

We don't set GOARM explicitly unless building the ARMv7 build

And as far as I can tell, the default is to build for ARMv6 and always has been.

I looked through the Go changelog and I don't think the default has changed.

So what I think must have happened is that the startup instructions in go1.15 now include an instruction which ARMv5 can't execute.

Can you try these 3 binaries and see which (if any work)

- [rclone-v1.53.0-armv5-go1.15.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/5167427/rclone-v1.53.0-armv5-go1.15.gz)
  - go1.15 with GOARM=5
- [rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.15.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/5167426/rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.15.gz)
  - go1.15 with GOARM unset
- [rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.14.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/5167423/rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.14.gz)
  - go1.14 with GOARM unset

I'm experincing the exact same issue. Just downloading rclone using `rclone.org/install.sh`, however all commands results in `Illegal instruction`. As for me, I'm on deep water here. How would i go about trying your proposed binaries @ncw ?

I'm using a Raspberry Pi Zero W, and i can't find *any* online documentation addressing how i can carry on from here. I'm going to use rclone for transfering dashcam footage from my car to google drive.

OP wrote that downgrading to 1.52 works. How do i do that?

Now that's interesting! Raspberry Pi Zero is an ARMv6, and that's easy to test because I have a few of these :smile: 

So @ncw the 3 binaries you linked in the message are all working on the Raspberry Pi. Then I tried the binary from a fresh `install.sh` and I do get the same issue

```
raspberrypi:~/pi $ file /usr/bin/rclone
/usr/bin/rclone: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, Go BuildID=yMkVTo8Dcvjomptc6Ugb/QVTNCV-uSSMnNiQeYe9K/Z_hRZbK59JC5of2yR67o/1GFdIRuvI6U-Ga0EzCrm, stripped
raspberrypi:~/pi/rclone $ file rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.15
rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.15: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, Go BuildID=Qu0302aUhG-lu0PQ-Y6K/nkuThTarnMVhJtk3Y6Y8/WmZQEIWhESviIkjz47kj/olnkqBxQzj0Kj3-NY1qL, not stripped
raspberrypi:~/pi/rclone $ uname -m
armv6l
raspberrypi:~/pi/rclone $ 
```

~Is the obvious difference in `stripped` and `not stripped`? but that's only the information for debuggers?~

~Actually I wonder if the `install.sh` is not downloading the arm-v7 version? because the rclone binary that I've downloaded from the Raspberry Pi Zero (via install.sh) works when running on a Raspberry Pi 3 (ARMv7)~

No it's not that either, the BuildID is from the `rclone-v1.53.0-linux-arm.zip` archive, so the `install.sh` is getting the right file.

> 
> 
> I just check the build script
> 
> https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/7e2488af10b316115217dc8246024d3de692d283/bin/cross-compile.go#L77
> 
> We don't set GOARM explicitly unless building the ARMv7 build
> 
> And as far as I can tell, the default is to build for ARMv6 and always has been.
> 
> I looked through the Go changelog and I don't think the default has changed.
> 
> So what I think must have happened is that the startup instructions in go1.15 now include an instruction which ARMv5 can't execute.
> 
> Can you try these 3 binaries and see which (if any work)
> 
>     * [rclone-v1.53.0-armv5-go1.15.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/5167427/rclone-v1.53.0-armv5-go1.15.gz)
>       
>       * go1.15 with GOARM=5
> 
>     * [rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.15.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/5167426/rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.15.gz)
>       
>       * go1.15 with GOARM unset
> 
>     * [rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.14.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/5167423/rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.14.gz)
>       
>       * go1.14 with GOARM unset

All those three binaries are working OK for me too.
@darren12345 How do i install the binaries? Also - should i uninstall my prior installed version first?

> @darren12345 How do i install the binaries? Also - should i uninstall my prior installed version first?

I didn‚Äôt uninstall anything. Right click the links and copy the URL.
On your machine, in your home directory (or wherever), download the file: `wget <url>`
Unzip the file: `gzip -d <filename>`
Make it executable: `chmod +x <filename>`
Execute it locally: `./<filename> -options`
That did it for me as well, using go1.14 with armunset. Now it executes ü§î

I'm experiencing the issue now, that when running the setup for the software i am installing, it uses the global "rclone" executable, and not the binary i downloaded. Do you know of a way for me to point `>_ rclone` towards my new working binary @darren12345 ? üòÑ

@Steven-Thelin 
- check where it's installed by running `which rclone`(it's likely to be `/usr/bin/rclone`)
- copy the binary over the one already installed `cp rclone-v1.53.0-armunset-go1.14 /usr/bin/rclone`
and you should be good üëç

> Thanks @creativeprojects ! Worked like a charm üòÑ

I was going to say, just ./ the full file name you downloaded and extracted. `./rclone_build_name_whatever`
